page.title: 20NUM STRIKE
page.content: Ours is a typical village of 350 people.Only 26 are miners.We shall never forget March 12,1984 when the Yorkshire pickets came and brought our pit to a standstill .The womens role was to form support groups.I marvel how well the children came out of it.Sometimes the village looked like a gangster film.Our strike centre was the Miners welfare.We gave out food parcels and helped with the mens problems.Our pit was solid for 10 months then some men went back to work.We showed no violence towards these men,people just stopped talking to them.They walked round with their heads down. The children never stopped playing together.Our pit was doomed anyway.It has only 4 years left now.The strike is over.Now we must learn to live in harmony.It will take time but I know we will succeed.
